channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Some U.S. Olympians live, train (and fall in love) in the countries they compete against
item.description: Some U.S. Olympians at the Winter Games spend most of their lives overseas, training and putting down roots in the countries they compete against.
item.content:encoded: Some U.S. Olympians at the Winter Games spend most of their lives overseas, training and putting down roots in the countries they compete against.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: What to expect from this week's State of the Union address by President Trump
item.description: Tariffs, DHS funding and international tensions are expected to be at the heart of the president's State of the Union speech to Congress this week.
item.content:encoded: Tariffs, DHS funding and international tensions are expected to be at the heart of the president's State of the Union speech to Congress this week.
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: History of mixed-race children orphaned in Germany after WWII inspires new novel by Sadeqa Johnson
item.description: NPR's Emily Kwong speaks with Sadeqa Johnson about her new novel THE KEEPER OF LOST CHILDREN and discovering the story of mixed-race children who were left in German orphanages following World War II.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Emily Kwong speaks with Sadeqa Johnson about her new novel THE KEEPER OF LOST CHILDREN and discovering the story of mixed-race children who were left in German orphanages following World War II.
item.dc:creator: Justine Kenin

item.title: Ukrainian military chaplain shares wisdom from the frontlines
item.description: Father Andriy Zelinskyy, a chaplain in wartime Ukraine, talks about what he sees in the trenches and what he's learned about the fragility of humanity, years into the war with Russia.
item.content:encoded: Father Andriy Zelinskyy, a chaplain in wartime Ukraine, talks about what he sees in the trenches and what he's learned about the fragility of humanity, years into the war with Russia.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ofman

item.title: Milan pushes back against the prime minister's immigration policies
item.description: In Milan, the site of the Winter Olympic Games, the mayor is taking steps to help migrants while the national governments seeks to discourage immigration.
item.content:encoded: In Milan, the site of the Winter Olympic Games, the mayor is taking steps to help migrants while the national governments seeks to discourage immigration.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: 'I stayed in this room for over a year and a half,' former inmate at Syria's Sednaya prison returns
item.description: An inmate who was imprisoned for 21 years in Syria's notorious Sadnaya prison shows NPR's Jane Arraf the concrete cells where he was held.
item.content:encoded: An inmate who was imprisoned for 21 years in Syria's notorious Sadnaya prison shows NPR's Jane Arraf the concrete cells where he was held.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: How do you cast the right actors to tell a story on screen?
item.description: An Academy Award in Best Casting will be the newest prize at the Oscars in March. An NPR panel examines what an achievement in casting might mean.
item.content:encoded: An Academy Award in Best Casting will be the newest prize at the Oscars in March. An NPR panel examines what an achievement in casting might mean.
item.dc:creator: Glen Weldon

item.title: Remembering salsa legend Willie Colon
item.description: Salsa legend, Willie Colon, has died at age 75. Colon was a key part of salsa's development in the 1970's as an instrumentalist, songwriter and producer.
item.content:encoded: Salsa legend, Willie Colon, has died at age 75. Colon was a key part of salsa's development in the 1970's as an instrumentalist, songwriter and producer.
item.dc:creator: Felix Contreras

item.title: Europe reacts to new tariffs announcement and more uncertainty
item.description: President Trump announced a 15% increase on tariffs across the board. Europeans have been celebrating yesterday's SCOTUS decision, but have been doing so quietly.
item.content:encoded: President Trump announced a 15% increase on tariffs across the board. Europeans have been celebrating yesterday's SCOTUS decision, but have been doing so quietly.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Hidden Levels podcast explains how the industry has grown from the arcade into a global juggernaut
item.description: Last year, the video game industry generated around $190 BILLION in revenue. More than the music and film industry combined. How did this medium go from the arcade into a global juggernaut? That's the subject of a new podcast series called Hidden Levels.
item.content:encoded: Last year, the video game industry generated around $190 BILLION in revenue. More than the music and film industry combined. How did this medium go from the arcade into a global juggernaut? That's the subject of a new podcast series called Hidden Levels.
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu
